poem:
Title: "In Paper's Embrace"

Margaret and Curtis,
soft-spined prophets in paper,
Currency of thought unbound.
Where pulp meets print,
the month's bounty blossoms,
An unassuming feast on the bazaar.
Yet within abbreviated margins dance,
ideas, full and delicious,
An echo of author's immortality,
Scribed in ink and more default.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "This month’s best paperbacks: Margaret Atwood, Curtis Sittenfeld and more default". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: This month’s best paperbacks: Margaret Atwood, Curtis Sittenfeld and more default
